alert.note: Alert for Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Cook, North Shore; Southern Lake, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 11:17PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF COOK AND CENTRAL LAKE COUNTIES THROUGH 1145 PM CDT... At 1117 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, to 11 miles east of Forest Center, to near Dumbbell Lake, to near Whyte, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Sea Gull Lake, Alpine Lake and Saganaga Lake around 1125 PM CDT. Gunflint Lake around 1135 PM CDT. Tofte and Finland around 1140 PM CDT. Lutsen, Little Marais and Eagle Mountain around 1145 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Ensign Lake, Kekekabic Lake, Bald Eagle Lake, Alice Lake, Murphy City, Perent Lake, Temperance River State Park, Phoebe Lake, North Lake and Kawishiwi Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Cook, North Shore; Southern Lake, North Shore
